abstract: Pres Obama will not be meeting with Prime Min Benjamin Netanyahu during Israeli leader's March visit, when he will address joint session of Congress to lobby for additional sanctions against Iran; Obama opposes sanctions but Republican takeover of Senate and House Speaker John Boehner's efforts to win powerful allies in fight with Obama over Iran's nuclear plans have given battle momentum.
lead_paragraph: When Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel visits the United States to lobby Congress for new sanctions that President Obama opposes, the two leaders will not meet, the White House said.

byline.contributor: David E. Sanger and Michael D. Shear reported from Washington, and Jodi Rudoren from Jerusalem. Julie Hirschfeld Davis contributed reporting from Lawrence, Kan.
byline.original: By DAVID E. SANGER, MICHAEL D. SHEAR and JODI RUDOREN

snippet: When Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel visits the United States to lobby Congress for new sanctions that President Obama opposes, the two leaders will not meet, the White House said.

headline.main: Obama Not Planning to Meet With Israeli Premier
headline.print_headline: Netanyahu’s U.S. Visit Won’t Include White House
